Dear Ms. Hardin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 3/11/25 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption
application and prior to approving a family for
adoption.
Two of three adoptive family evaluations reviewed did not complete the adoptive
evaluation within 90 days of the family signing an adoption application.
Repeat Violation Established
2024 Interim, CAP approved 5/23/2024

• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period. The one CAP submitted was in response to the 2024 interim
inspection completed on 5/9/24 and the CAP was approved on 5/23/24. The
agency was cited for 2 violations, 1 of which was repeated this reporting period.
The repeated violation in 2024 was CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family
evaluation. The agency will need to establish additional corrective action planning
for the repeated violation to ensure a reduction of this violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed on site 2/13/2025 with
the Chief Administrator. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported the agency
identified barriers such as worker and supervisor oversight and new staff hire
training. CA reported staff turnover was not a concern during this review period,
but human error and oversight did occur. CA reported the lag time in getting
newer staff up to speed in learning how to effectively complete required tasks. CA
reported new staff caused KPI percentages and tasks to be late due to not being
completed timely as they learn their positions. She reported there is no grace
period with new staff. The system is a pass/fail system. It does not account for
efforts, only achievement. CA reported a positive impact from the CAP activities
are additional training and knowledge to the agency staff on requirements. Staff
receive a review of the requirements and/are made aware of short comings.
Financial Overview:
The agency certified independent auditor’s report dated September 2023 and
2022, and the agency annual budget report was reviewed. There were no financial
concerns identified.

Staff Interviews:
Three staff were interviewed onsite 2/13/25. Staff interviewed stated there is
excellent teamwork and great guidance from supervisory and administrative staff.
Staff reported getting the necessary training needed to complete their job
responsibilities and reported it is a great environment to work in with everybody
communicating within each department and caseworker. Staff did not report any
concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The office has adequate space and equipment for the staff members to complete
their required responsibilities. Physical CHRI and case files are all stored securely,
preventing unauthorized access. No concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
